Operation 'get-transactions' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is too generic ('Get all transactions'). Description contains deprecated version warning that should be removed per API context. Missing clarity on required parameters (at least one must be provided), response structure, and pagination mechanism. Added specific parameter requirements, response schema reference, and pagination details for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
Versions 1 and 2 of the Transfers API are deprecated. If you are just starting your implementation, use the latest version.

Returns all the transactions related to a balance account, account holder, or balance platform.

When making this request, you must include at least one of the following:
- `balanceAccountId`
- `accountHolderId`
- `balancePlatform`.
 
This endpoint supports cursor-based pagination. The response returns the first page of results, and returns links to the next and previous pages when applicable. You can use the links to page through the results.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve transactions for a balance account or holder
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all transactions associated with a specified balance account, account holder, or balance platform. At least one of the following query parameters must be provided: `balanceAccountId`, `accountHolderId`, or `balancePlatform`. The response uses cursor-based pagination and returns the first page of results with links to navigate subsequent pages. Returns a TransactionSearchResponse containing an array of Transaction objects.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic ('Get all transactions'). Description contains deprecated version warning that should be removed per API context. Missing clarity on required parameters (at least one must be provided), response structure, and pagination mechanism. Added specific parameter requirements, response schema reference, and pagination details for better AI agent decision-making.

Returns a transaction.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a specific transaction by ID
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information for a specific transaction identified by its unique transaction ID. Returns a Transaction object containing transaction details including amount, currency, parties involved, status, and timestamps.

Added information about required request fields, response schema, webhook notification mechanism, and prerequisites (role and account configuration) to help AI agents understand the full operation lifecycle and side effects.

data.current_description:
Versions 1 and 2 of the Transfers API are deprecated. If you are just starting your implementation, use the latest version.

Starts a transfer request to move funds within your balance platform, or send funds to a [transfer instrument](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/legalentity/v1/post/transferInstruments). Adyen sends the outcome of the transfer request through webhooks.

To use this endpoint, you need an additional role for your API credential and transfers must be enabled for the source balance account. Your Adyen contact will set these up for you.
data.description_suggestion: Initiates a transfer request to move funds within your balance platform or to a transfer instrument. Requires a TransferInfoOld request body specifying source and destination accounts, amount, and currency. The operation is asynchronous - the endpoint returns a transfer confirmation, and Adyen sends the final transfer outcome via webhooks. Requires API credential with transfer role and transfers enabled on the source balance account. Returns a Transfer object with the transfer ID and initial status.
data.reasoning: Original description contains deprecated version warning to be removed. Missing critical details about request body structure (TransferInfoOld schema), response format, and asynchronous nature of the operation. Added information about required request fields, response schema, webhook notification mechanism, and prerequisites (role and account configuration) to help AI agents understand the full operation lifecycle and side effects.
